availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
STATE OF NEW YORK
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
Corning Tower The Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Empire State Plaza Albany, New York 12237
Antonia C. Novello, M.D., M.P.H.
Commissioner
Dennis P. Whalen
Executive Deputy Commissioner
September 18, 2001
CHRISTOPHER MOSHER
41 BROOK PINE DRIVE
SHELTON, CT 06484
Re: Genealogy Record
Requested Name: WILLIAM D. MOSHER
Relationship: Direct-line Ancestor
Date Range: 04/12/1885 - 04/12/1885
Type: DEATH: Uncertified
Dear CHRISTOPHER MOSHER
NO RECORD CERTIFICATION
This is to certify that a diligent search of vital records on file with the New York State
Department of Health has been made for the person listed above.
The record has not been found. It is hereby certified, pursuant to requirements of Rule
4521 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules, legal custody of the above specified official records
belongs to the New York State Department of Health.
Further inquiries may be made of the registrar of vital statistics in the district in which
it is believed the event occurred.
If a refund is issued, a check will be forwarded to you in about 12 weeks from the Office
of the State Comptroller.
If you have further questions in this matter, please refer to the CR # indicated in the
lower light comer of this letter in all future correspondence.
Thank you,
Certification Unit
Vital Records Section
P.O. Box 2602
Albany, NY 12220-2602
DOCUMENTATION: (NR )
jmtOl C011070072-1 (04861)
DOH-2798 (2/99)
STATE OF NEW YORK
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH

Antonia C. Novello, M.D.. M.P.H., Dr.P.H.

September 18, 2001
CHRISTOPHER MOSHER
41 BROOK PINE DRIVE
SHELTON, CT 06484
Re: Genealogy Record
Requested Name: WILLIAM D. MOSHER
Relationship: Direct-line Ancestor
Reason: Other
Type: DEATH: Uncertified
Dear CHRISTOPHER MOSHER
Your vital records copy request was processed. If copies for more than one person
or several types of records (i.e., birth, marriage, death) were requested, and those
copies are not enclosed, they will be sent separately. If you need to contact us about
this request, please be certain to include the transaction number appearing at the
bottom right of this page.
Thank you,
Certification Unit
Vital Records Section
P.O. Box 2602
Albany, NY 12220-2602

Certificate and Record of Death.

FOR GENEALOGICAL RESEARCH ONLY
I hereby certify that I attended deceased from about Apr 2 1900, to May 14th 1900,
that I last saw him alive on the 112 day of May 1900, that he died on the
19 day of May 1900, about 12 o’clock, A.M., and that to the best of my
knowledge and belief, the cause of his death was as hereunder written.
Duration of Disease.
Chief Cause, Senile debiltay
Contributing Cause, Bronchitus
Sanitary Observations,
Witness my hand this 21 day of May 1900
(Signature),
Geo B Palmer M. D.

East Hamilton NY

FOR GENEALOGICAL RESEARCH ONLY
NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
Vital Records Section, Genealogy Unit
Corning Tower Building, Empire State Plaza
Albany, New York 12237-0023
General Information and Application
for Genealogical Services
Partially searched
VITAL RECORDS COPIES CANNOT BE PROVIDED FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.
2 searches
1. FEE - $11.00 includes search and uncertified copy or notification of no record.
2. Original records of births and marriages for the entire state begin with 1881, deaths begin with 1880, EXCEPT for records
filed in Albany, Buffalo and Yonkers prior to 1914. Applications for these cities should be made directly to the local office.
3. The New York State Department of Health does not have New York City records except for births occurring in Queens and
Richmond counties for the years 1881 through 1897.
4. Please read the Administrative Rule Summary on the reverse side of this sheet which specifies years available for genealogical
not searched

belief the cause of death was as follows:

THIS IS TO CERTIFY that a search has been made in this office for the death
record of Elethur Mosher (Moshier),
which death is said to have occurred on 1842 - 1900
(Date of Death)
at Town of south Bristol, State of New York and that such
(Place of Death)
record is not on file in this office. Search has been made for the period
from 1883 (when our records start) to 1900.
Witness my signature this 11th day of August 1994
Betty Collins
Registrar of Vital Statistics
Town of South Bristol, New York
27562
CERTIFICATE OF DEATH
Wm Mosher
Pokeepsie NY
